Class ContentFlag

java.lang.Object
application.ContentFlag
public class ContentFlag extends Object

The ContentFlag class represents a flag placed on content by staff members for review. This class is used to track inappropriate, concerning, or problematic content within the system including questions, answers, reviews, and private messages.

Each flag contains information about what content was flagged, who flagged it, why it was flagged, and the current status of the flag (Pending, Reviewed, or Resolved).

This class uses JavaFX properties to enable easy binding with UI components such as TableView.

Since:
2025-01-16

  • Constructor Details

    • ContentFlag

      public ContentFlag(int flagId, String contentType, String contentId, String flaggedBy, String reason, String status, Timestamp createdAt)
      Constructs a new ContentFlag instance with all required information. The timestamp is formatted to a human-readable string format (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm).
      Parameters:
      flagId - unique identifier for this flag
      contentType - type of content (question, answer, message, review)
      contentId - ID of the specific content being flagged
      flaggedBy - username of the staff member who flagged the content
      reason - explanation for why the content was flagged
      status - current status of the flag (Pending, Reviewed, Resolved)
      createdAt - timestamp when the flag was created
